item.title: The Middle-Age Dilemma: Truths We Can't Ignore
item.description:
The Bittersweet Reality of Aging

Recently, a speaker addressed 700 university alumni on “The Dilemma After Middle-Age” - what followed was equal parts laughter and uncomfortable recognition.

The Harsh Truths of Time

“Tomorrow will be better” makes for a nice song lyric, but in reality:

  • The only certainty is that tomorrow, we’ll be older
  • Gravity becomes less of a theory and more of a personal experience
  • As the saying goes: “Everything sags except blood pressure”
